abstract: In buying Burlington Northern Santa Fe, Warren E. Buffett is hoping that the demand for shipping by train will remain strong or even grow.
snippet: In buying Burlington Northern Santa Fe, Warren E. Buffett is hoping that the demand for shipping by train will remain strong or even grow.
lead_paragraph: America’s best-known investor, Warren E. Buffett, is making his biggest bet yet on the nation’s economic future by buying, of all things, a railroad.

headline.main: Buffett Bets Big on Railroads’ Future
headline.print_headline: Buffett Bets Big That Railroads Have a Future

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Andrew Ross Sorkin

abstract: Warren E. Buffett says he thinks the business of transporting goods around the country is ready to rebound. But investors may want to delay hitching a ride on his caboose.
snippet: Warren E. Buffett says he thinks the business of transporting goods around the country is ready to rebound. But investors may want to delay hitching a ride on his caboose.
lead_paragraph: What does Warren E. Buffett see in railroads? Berkshire Hathaway, his investment company, is paying a big premium for Burlington Northern Santa Fe. Mr. Buffett says he thinks the business of transporting goods around the country is ready to rebound. But investors may want to delay hitching a ride on his caboose.

headline.main: Riding the Rails at a High Price
headline.print_headline: Riding the Rails At a High Price

byline.original: By Richard Beales and Robert Cyran

abstract: What does Warren E. Buffett see in railroads? Berkshire Hathaway, his investment company, is paying a big premium for Burlington Northern Santa Fe, Breakingviews says.
snippet: What does Warren E. Buffett see in railroads? Berkshire Hathaway, his investment company, is paying a big premium for Burlington Northern Santa Fe, Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: What does Warren E. Buffett see in railroads? Berkshire Hathaway, his investment company, is paying a big premium for Burlington Northern Santa Fe, Breakingviews says. Mr. Buffett says he thinks the business of transporting goods around the country is ready to rebound. But investors may want to delay hitching a ride on his caboose.

headline.main: Riding the Rails at a High Price?
